title: How to Buy a Modular Kitchen

parts.name: Selecting the Layout, Appliances, and Units

steps.headline: Choose the layout for your kitchen.
steps.description: The layout and shape of the kitchen play a crucial role in space utilization. The most common kitchen shapes are L-shaped, U-shaped, straight (or galley), and parallel. You could also opt for an island design. Think about the location of doors and windows in your home as well as existing appliances, plumbing, and electrical outlets in order to determine what will work best for you.

steps.headline: Select your appliances.
steps.description: Choose appliances based on the specific needs of your household. You can choose from ovens, stovetops, grills, microwaves, refrigerators, sinks, dishwashers, and more. You may even be able to choose between gas and electric ranges, depending on where you live.

steps.headline: Figure out your electrical points.
steps.description: Decide where you’ll put your refrigerator, stove and oven, chimney, microwave, and other electric appliances. You can then figure out where your electrical points need to be, such as light switches and outlets.

steps.headline: Factor in plumbing.
steps.description: Decide where you’d like your sink to go so that proper plumbing can be set up. You can add in an under-sink unit to house the plumbing that also has space for a swing-down waste bin and/or a pull-out for dish soap and other sink essentials.

steps.headline: Determine the height and depth of countertops and cabinets.
steps.description: Kitchens should be designed ergonomically to avoid back pains. Since you’re designing the kitchen from scratch, you can choose the height and depth of the countertops and cabinets. You can even ask your kitchen designer if they can customize items according to your height.

steps.headline: Decide how many base units you'll incorporate into the kitchen.
steps.description: Base units or undercounter units are the main storage spaces for heavy or seldom-used kitchen equipment. You can also include cutlery and utensil drawers as well as rotating corner units.

steps.headline: Select the number and style of wall units.
steps.description: Kitchen wall units are used to store dishes and kitchen equipment. You can choose from horizontal units, corner shelving units, crockery units, spice units, and more. Remember to leave space for the chimney/exhaust vent when choosing wall units for the kitchen. Full-height cupboards are available for your refrigerator or microwave. They can also house pantry items as well as cleaning supplies and tall items like brooms.

steps.headline: Choose accessories.
steps.description: You can add many accessories to the kitchen for your convenience. A few useful accessories to have include: a waste disposal unit, a detergent holder unit, a bottle pullout unit, a double corner pull unit, a rolling cart, drawer dividers, and a kitchen carousel unit.

steps.headline: Choose quality materials.
steps.description: There are numerous options when it comes to choosing the materials your units, countertops, and flooring will be made from. Though you may be interested in saving money, don’t choose all the cheapest options. Think about how long you want your modular kitchen to last as well as your environmental conditions (e.g., high humidity) when selecting materials and finishes.

steps.headline: Select the materials for your countertops.
steps.description: Countertops can be made from granite, acrylic, laminate, travertine, epoxy, and more. Premium quality granite is the best option as it resists heat, scratches, and stains and protects against mold and mildew. It also offers an endless variety of different patterns of veins, specks, and swirls.

steps.headline: Pick the materials for your cabinet units.
steps.description: Units are available in materials including pre-laminated MDF, pre-laminated particle board, or boiling waterproof (BWP) plywood with lamination. A waterproof option, like BWP, is a durable choice for units and will hold up regardless of drips, spill, and humid conditions. You can also choose glass shutters for your cabinet units or choose from several colors of MDF, particle board, and BWP.

steps.headline: Select the finish for your units.
steps.description: The carcass -- the top, bottom, and side panels of a unit -- will be made out of the material you select. The front of the unit can be customized with different finishes to match your style and decor. You can choose from matte or glossy, and choose from a wide variety of colors. Consider the colors of your wall and flooring when selecting a finish for your units. Matte surfaces are more scratch-resistant, but glossy finishes are easier to clean.

steps.headline: Choose your flooring.
steps.description: Floors can be constructed out of hardwood, bamboo, cork, laminate, marble, and vinyl, or tiles made from porcelain, stone, or ceramic. Cork is an eco-friendly choice for flooring that is hypoallergenic as well as warm and unique.

steps.headline: Search by location.
steps.description: Do an Internet search to find modular kitchen vendors in your area. Choose one that’s not too far from your home so they can easily install the modular kitchen in your home in a timely manner as well as have access to a warehouse full of options. If you pick a vendor that is far away, you may have to wait longer to get your modular kitchen installed.

steps.headline: Compare pricing as you browse different vendors.
steps.description: Different companies may charge vastly different amounts for similar setups. Use price estimators on company websites to compare prices for similar units. Some companies may offer lowered prices for taking factory-direct supplies. Decide what you need in your kitchen, and customize the component and material type depending upon your budget.

steps.headline: Compare warranties.
steps.description: While some vendors offer a 10-year warranty, other companies only warranty their products for one year. Compare warranties from different vendors, and if you have the choice, choose the longest warranty possible to ensure your modular kitchen will continue looking great and functioning properly for many years to come.

steps.headline: Read reviews.
steps.description: You can find out if other customers are satisfied with their experience with a modular kitchen company by reading reviews. Pay attention to whether other customers were happy with the speed of the installation, the quality of the unit, and the price they paid.
